public ref class Send sealed : System::Activities::Activity

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("Content")

Docs.summary: An activity that sends a message to a service.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows how to create a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> activity and add it to a workflow. The example also shows how to use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ReceiveReply> activity to receive the reply message.
[!code-csharp[ChannelCache#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/channelcache/cs/client.cs#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of the action header of the message being sent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send.Action%2A> property has not been explicitly set, it defaults to: `https://tempuri.org/{service contract namespace}/{service contract name}/{operation name}`. If specified on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send> activity, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Receive> activity that receives the message must have the same value for the message to be delivered correctly.

set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the content sent by the activity.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The content can be one of the following types: <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageContent> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendParametersContent>. Use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendMessageContent> when sending a message <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.Message> or a message contract type. Use <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.SendParametersContent> when sending data contract types.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a correlation handle that is used to route the message to the appropriate workflow instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When implementing the request/reply message exchange pattern, it must be set to the same correlation handle as the corresponding <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.ReceiveReply> activity.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of correlation initializers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks For more information about correlation see [Correlation](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/correlation.md).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the endpoint to send messages to.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this property is set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send.EndpointConfigurationName%2A> property should be `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the endpoint configuration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is set when you are configuring an endpoint in a configuration file. This property should be set to the name given in the `<endpoint>` element in your configuration file. If this property is set, the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send.Endpoint%2A> property should be `null`.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property KnownTypes As Collection(Of Type)

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the known types for the service operation to be called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property should be used in conjunction with the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.DataContractSerializer>. It is ignored if <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer> has been selected as the serializer. For more information about known types, see [Data Contract Known Types](~/docs/framework/wcf/feature-details/data-contract-known-types.md).

get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the service operation to be called.
Docs.value: The name of the service operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The operation name is used to construct the default value for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send.Action%2A> property if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Activities.Send.Action%2A> property is not set. This property must be specified. If not set, an error is thrown.
